title: Football : Khaldiya face Iraq club
body_text:
FOOTBALL – Bahrain champions Al Khaldiya are in action tonight in the 2024-25 AFC Champions League (ACL) Two.
They take on Air Force SC of Iraq at 7pm at the National Stadium in Riffa. The game will be the second time both sides are meeting in Group B of this stage in the ACL Two.
The Bahrainis won their previous clash held last month in Baghdad 2-1.
Khaldiya head into this evening’s contest currently in second place on their division table.
They are tied with both Al Taawoun FC of Saudi Arabia, who are the leaders, and Air Force, who are third. All three clubs are on six points. Altyn Asyr FC of Turkmenistan are in last place with zero points.
Altyn Asyr host Taawoun in today’s other Group B fixture in Ashgabat.
